name: Sofitel Philadelphia Hotel

reviews.title: A good choice with very good service
reviews.text: Enjoyed a long weekend at the Sofitel Philadelphia. The location is more than central and convenient, the room generally nice, but the level of attentive service was perhaps the selling point.

reviews.title: c'est si bon
reviews.text: Desk and lobby staff were attentive and helpful; and cleaning staff kept the room notably in in very clean order. Room 624 was large if a bit oddly arranged with case and seating furniture set hard along one long wall, presumably to keep floor area open as I noticed it was one of the hotel's handicapped accessible rooms -- also with a rather oversized bathroom with good towels and L'Occitane amenities. The room has a Bose radio and a large flatscreen TV (though set far forward on a swivel stand atop a large cabinet, effectively undoing any space savings by sticking with the pattern for the old tube-style set.) Beds with their down toppers were very comfortable and the room quiet at night.

reviews.title: Not quite luxury
reviews.text: On checking in, I left the baggage with a porter to run out on an errand only to realized I'd misplaced my wallet. Assuming I might have left at the registration desk, I phoned the hotel and was connected immediately with a helpful security manager who investigated and immediately checked security CCTV footage where it was clear I had replaced my wallet in my pocket. All this was done within minutes and, again, very courteously. Overall, the rooms are at the lower end of 4-stars, with a couple of 5-star features.

reviews.title: A Decent High End Stay
reviews.text: As for faults, the furnishings and fittings in the guest room were mostly of a sort of middling quality and showing a bit of wear - to echo a concern of other reviewers. While I saw the door staff jump to help a couple with a baby stroller, they were otherwise a little absent both in often being away from the doors or in not making any acknowledgment of the guests coming and going.

reviews.title: This hotel should receive four circles, but....
reviews.text: We recently had our wedding at the Sofitel Philadelphia. Most of our guests also stayed at the hotel after the wedding. We couldn't have picked a better place for the wedding and our guests. The rooms were well appointed and very comfortable. The hotel staff was very attentive and welcoming. The food at the wedding was delicious! The next morning we hosted a private brunch, which was very nicely set up. Not one detail was overlooked. I highly recommend this hotel!

reviews.title: another good stay
reviews.text: From the front desk with Anna to the helpful William in the conciege area, this hotel has it done right. They did not hesitate to change to hypoallergic pillows and to put on a top sheet on the bed. The early morning coffee is a plus. The room size is great and the location a plus as there are several very good restaurants nearby. No doubt I will be back. Cheers !

reviews.title: What Luxury!
reviews.text: As soon as we breezed through the spacious and well-appointed lobby, we felt like we had been transported to another world far removed from the usual bustle of our lives. The receptionist was exceptionally friendly and welcoming and made check in an entirely pleasant experience.

reviews.title: Good Hotel in Center City
reviews.text: The room itself was exactly what one wants a hotel room to be: spacious, well laid-out, immaculate, and tastefully decorated. The beds were incredibly comfortable; in fact, I wish I had them in my home! I loved the European-style duvet in place of a starchy blanket. The bathroom, too, was ideal. It had a large shower and a separate bathtub.

reviews.title: Sad to leave...
reviews.text: We were so occupied with seeing the sights that we didn't have time to check out the other hotel amenities. Nor did we didn't eat in any of the hotel restaurants, but I did have a drink at the bar and enjoyed not only a perfectly composed (and strong!) cocktail, but also efficient service and complimentary snacks with some of the most succulent olives I have ever had.

reviews.title: Great downtown hotel
reviews.text: The Sofitel is centrally located in Philadelphia, in walking distance to all sights and numerous restaurants. Rittenhouse Square is only two blocks away. After a long day of wandering through the city, it was an utter delight to return to our quiet room which our maid had discretely "turned down" with fresh bottles of water and soft music playing on the Bose system. A perfect experience!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: I've stayed here a couple times and generally love the hotel. It's modern, clean, has nice furnishings, etc. Service is excellent - all of the staff i ever dealt with were curtious and professional. It's also a great location, just off Rittenhouse square. I got the "Breakfast Drive" package both times, which comes with breakfast in the restaurant downstairs (which was quite good) and parking.
reviews.title: Great hotel, just one problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: My only complaint is with the bathrooms. I stayed in a suite both times i was there, so not sure if the same problem exists for regular rooms. The bathroom itself is very nice, but there are double doors that open to each end of the room. Problem is, these doors DO NOT LOCK and there is a 1/2" gap between the doors that anybody standing on the other side could easily look through, even accidentally.
reviews.title: Very Nice
Great location, L'Occitane toiletries, polished service and great bed!
reviews.text: This may not be a problem if you're travelling alone or with a spouse, but it certainly becomes a problem if you have visitors and/or if you are travelling with children. Not sure what would posess somebody to design bathroom doors that way or think that it would somehow be a good idea. The hotel couple probably fix it relatively easily . . . but maybe i'm the only one who has a problem with it. Or maybe the French like watching each other go to the bathroom . . . ?

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My stay was three days on a business trip. I took the train from the airport to downtown and the hotel was a nice, 3 block walk from the Suburban Station. I was very pleasantly surprised by the vibrancy of downtown Philadelphia and there was lots of shopping and restaurants within easy walking distance of the hotel. The hotel staff was very polite and accommodating.
reviews.title: Philadelphia getaway by Philadelphians...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here with my husband and our two small dogs during New Year's Eve 2012 in a junior suite. The suite was incredibly spacious and clean (including the bathroom) and the location was perfect. The bed was soft and comfortable and there was more than enough room for the dogs to run around. The suite had a little entry area, separate sitting area with desk and a television, and the bedroom was very large with an attached dressing area that led into the bathroom (which has another door leading from the entry). Only minor complaint was that we had to wait about 15 minutes to check in (our room was not ready) and the front desk gave us complimentary drink coupons for the hotel bar while we were waiting. Having stayed here and Hotel Palomar (in a deluxe one bedroom suite) across the street during the prior New Year's Even, we would choose Sofitel for the size of the rooms and overall value.
reviews.title: Gigantic rooms, Pet-friendly!
4.5 - Great service and nice hotel
reviews.text: I had a nightmare trip getting here, thanks to an airline which I usually have great luck with. My flights were delayed such that I called to let the hotel know that I wouldn't arrive until the next morning - the rep promised that they would check me in 'in absentia' so I wouldn't lose my room (it's sold out for a conference this week).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012
reviews.text: When I arrived and went to check in, my booking was nowhere to be found - oh no!
reviews.title: No better place to stay in Philadelphia!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fortunately, Hector soon discovered that the info from my call hadn't made it to the front desk and that I was on the no-show list. After 30 hours traveling, I could have cried! All I wanted was a nap and a shower.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel but expensive!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Communication lapse happens from time to time to the best of us...no sense getting upset until we see if it can be fixed...
reviews.title: A great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stayed here for a weekend at the beginning of August 2012. Staff was very friendly and professional, and check in was very quick. Security measures included using your key card to access your floor via elevator. Our room was on the 7th floor and was clean, modern, and decorated nicely. The Bose clock radios were a very nice touch. The best part about thsi room was the bed. My wife is still raving about how comfortable it was. It is located within walking distance to most of the City's main attractions, although it is a bit further from the Independence Hall area than other hotels I have stayed at. We did not get an opportunity to eat at the hotel restaurant or visit the hotel bar, so I can't comment on those. Parking is quite expensive, and you could save about $ 12 +/- a night by parking in one of the several nearby garages.
reviews.title: Amazing Bed, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled solo
reviews.text: The Sofitel is in a great downtown location near Rittenhouse Square, shops, restaurants, transport. Attended a conference and Sofitel had all the facilities. Good room size with great bed. Only downside was poor room lighting, gentle lighting around the room. Could hardly see in the room. Bar OK and OK food. Not cheap though.
reviews.title: Great location, good size rooms, high incidental daily charge

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My fiance and I took a trip to Philadelphia between July 29th until Aug 1st. Stayed at Sofitel for 3 nights, and had the time of our lives!
reviews.title: Had a Blast in Philadelphia!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Knowing that parking is an issue, we have done our research and was able to park at a more affordable self-park lot for $28 per night (with parking coupon which you can print online), compared to the $40 per night valet parking it really was a big help. The self-park was only half a block from Sofitel so it was really easy!
reviews.title: A really great hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We got a great deal on Expedia for this hotel, otherwise we would be paying close to $250 a night... we had a deal where we stay 2 nights and the 3rd night is free. sweet deal.
reviews.title: Great rooms and a great fitness center

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I spent the weekend at the Sofitel and had a great time. We were warmly greeted as soon as we drove up and that continued through the easy check in process. The room was very clean and had a great view of the Philadelphia skyscrapers. The bathroom was very spacious with a tub and separate shower. The restaurant in the lobby served amazing breakfasts and the location made it very easy to walk to shops and the art museum area. We highly recommend and will for sure stay there again.
reviews.title: Perfect Weekend Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I recently stayed here for one night and couldn't have been more pleased, not just with the location but also with the service and our room.
reviews.title: A Good Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: We hadn't been in Philadelphia in a number of years and were surprised by what we found. The Sofitel is located in an excellent spot close to shops, restaurants and museums. We parked our car with the hotel valet and never used it again until we left.
reviews.title: First time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The first room we were given was on a low floor and we thought we heard street noise. So I called the front desk and asked to be given a room on an upper floor if one was available. They handled the request with no problem. Our new room was a little less spacious but was very nice, with a comfortable mattress and lots of pillows. The bathroom was terrific, with a separate glass-enclosed shower. Though we didn't need the space since we were staying only one night, I thought the amount of drawer space was lacking. As for the street noise on the higher floor, it was non-existent.
reviews.title: Wonderful Wedding Weekend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very good meal in the hotel dining room the next morning, and although we never used it, the lobby bar looked very inviting.
reviews.title: Great stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: My friend and I just returned from a weekend visit to Philadelphia to celebrate our birthdays. Each year we choose a different city and always stay in a Sofitel where possible. The Philadelphia location was the 5th Sofitel we have stayed at, and this recent visit has confirmed to us that there really is no other hotel chain that compares. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty by every staff member that we had the pleasure of meeting. Check-in was extremely efficient and our room was absolutely perfect, with the ultra comfortable beds that the Sofitel brand is famous for, and a sparkling clean bathrooms with separate tub and glass shower. Housekeeping did a fantastic job each day, not only of cleaning the room but also providing a wonderful turn-down service each evening. The black-out curtains shut out all the light, allowing us to sleep a little late each morning in the fluffy beds. Concierge was very knowledgeable and we enjoyed several apple martinis in the hotel bar while watching the people pass by outside. The location was great, just a short block from the shops and restaurants of Walnut Street and Rittenhouse Row. We had great pizza and pasta at Pietro's just around the corner and there were several choices for breakfast. Most of the city's attractions were within walking distance of the hotel, including the Museum of Art and Independence Hall. The only time we needed a car was to visit the Barnes Foundation, but that will be moving to the Museum District within a couple of years. All in all, it was a trip that I am sure we will be remembering fondly for many years to come and we hope to go back again soon. Thanks in particular to Nicolas and Susanne for all your attention in making sure our stay was so perfect - we feel like you and your team are part of our family. We highly recommend the Sofitel Philadelphia and fully endorse it's top ranking here - it has been well deserved.
reviews.title: A Perfect Hotel Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After what was supposed to be a long weekend in Mexico turned into a weekend with nowhere to go, my cousin and I ended up in Philly. I did some quick research on Trip Advisor and settled on the Sofitel. I generally prefer historic or boutique hotels but after my experience at the Sofitel, it will be the only place I ever stay when in Philadelphia. Everyone, from the valet to the people who checked us in were friendly, helpful AND professional. The outside of the building leaves much to be desired but the lobby, bar and room were amazing! We arrived on a Friday afternoon and had every intention of immediately heading out for the evening. That didn’t happen as quickly as we planned because, well, the beds were to die for and nap was absolutely in order! After we dragged ourselves out of bed, we had drinks at the bar before going out on the town. It was refreshing to be out at happy hour in a bar with other grownups. No drink specials, no loud music and nothing was overpriced. Rittenhouse Square is “the” place, with shops and great restaurants. We were so impressed with the hotel and service that we even discussed returning for a second night. It’s has been a week since our stay and although we had a terrific time in the city, we are still talking and dreaming about those beds!
reviews.title: Refined yet hip

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Sofitel is ideally located in the city centre, convenient for all shops,
reviews.title: Highy recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008
reviews.text: sights and nightlife.
reviews.title: Loved the whole experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Staff really helpful. A 'superior' room is worth paying at little extra for. Rooms
reviews.title: Attractive, comfortable, a bit overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Very nice hotel. Super comfy bed!! Love the French door bathroom..privacy was not an issue as mentioned by other reviewer. Very quiet hotel in a very nice corner of the city. One can walk safely and easily to all the main historical attractions and lots of places to eat and drink in the neighborhood. Very close to upscale shopping if that's your thing. Nicely decorated lobby bar and restaurant. Helpful and bilingual (French) staff.
reviews.title: Lovely Hotel
Great hotel
reviews.text: Just stayed here on a friday night,shopped around for best price in city & sofitel offered best deal, walked to merrian theatre, rooms here are excellent!! Location great! Lobby bar fantastic,service & cleanliness couldn,t have been better. They held our bags all day saturday while we toured historic phila, i would definitely recommend this property & great location for theatre or touring phila,best way around town is to walk. Also had great breakfast one block away at little pete,s diner. Zagat rated diner open 24 hrs.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stay in a lot of hotels due to my work travels and I have never written a review for a hotel ... until now. I stayed at the Sofitel in Philly for a work meeting that was held here for 3 days and I wished the meeting had lasted for a week so I could have stayed in this hotel longer. If you are charmed by anything "French" you should stay here. Loved everything about this hotel. Every single staff member I encountered (the bell men, the catering staff, the housekeeping staff) really understood and displayed the idea of superb customer service. The room I stayed in was so roomy and comfortable. And the bathroom was fabulous: I had a walk-in shower and a separate tub to enjoy a relaxing bath and it had a handheld shower head. The location was a little off the main street (which actually was good) but you could walk just 1-3 blocks for most things (restaurants, Starbucks, CVS, clothing stores). Finally, you should stay here for no other reason than to request a wake up call ... seriously, this is the BEST wake-up message ever, cute and clever. I can't wait to come back to stay in this hotel the next time I'm in Philly.
reviews.title: I've never written a hotel review ... until now.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were here for two nights and really enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Excellent Stay at the Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 2 nights on a weekend break and got a great rate by paying in advance on the hotels own website accorhotels.
reviews.title: Excellent location and spacious room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled on business
reviews.text: The location is ideal for Rittenhouse Square and shopping and the sights. Room well maintained with very comfy bed, nice sitting are, flatscreen tv and spacious bathroom with seperate bath and shower.
reviews.title: Dont stay here-stay at Kimpton directly across the street

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was in Philly for a 3-day business trip. My other colleagues stayed at a hotel around the corner but I wanted to stay at the Sofitel because of all of the good reviews I read on this website. I couldn't have imagined how disappointed I would be by this hotel. As someone who has medallion-level airline status, I travel frequently and have stayed at many hotels. My conference began early in the day and ended at noon on the last day. So instead of rushing around in the morning, I asked the front desk for a late checkout the night before my departure. I was told that I had to check back in the morning despite the fact that the hotel was not sold out that night. So I called the morning of my departure as soon as I woke up and was told that the manager wasnt available and asked to call back 45 minutes. This didnt help me because I needed to be at my conference in 45 minutes . I called the hotel on my cellphone as I was leaving the hotel to get the late checkout even though I wasn't packed. Fortunately I was able to get the late checkout at 8am. I have never experienced this before. Also, they charge $9.95 a day for internet. My colleagues that were staying at the Crowne Plaza got internet for free and I would have considered the Sofitel above the Crowne Plaza. My advice to people looking to stay in this area-walk across the street and stay at the Kimpton (free internet and late checkout if available) or the Crowne Plaza.
reviews.title: Treated Like Royalty

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Last weekend me and my wife, celebrated our 7th wedding anniversary. We have young kids so could only get away for a day. When I made my reservation, I innocently told the chap on the phone this was our anniversary, and if he could get me a good room that would be appreciated.
reviews.title: Best Hotel Experience EVER!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011
reviews.text: Well, what a surprise, we arrived at the Sofitel and Director of Guest Services, smiled and said she would escort us to our room. She opens the door and presents us with the Presidential Suite. It was the most grand room we have ever stayed in. The Presidential suite had four rooms, views of the city on all sides, a lavish bathroom with Jacuzzui, flat screen televisions in every room, an espresso maker, a collection of lovely artwork on the walls.
reviews.title: Good rooms, comfy beds, great service and location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I should start by saying that I found reasonable hotel rates for Sofitel Philadelphia through the website, Tablet - for only $170 per night. We did have to pre-pay for our 3-night stay but the price seemed so reasonable. And I should add that I have not stayed at a Sofitel hotel before so my expectations were low.
reviews.title: Luxury at reasonable prices

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What a pleasant surprise - our stay at Sofitel was luxurious and comfy. The room was quite large for one of the cheaper options, and the bed was ridiculously comfortable. A king-sized bed with an extra cushiony mattress. It seriously felt as if we were sleeping in a cloud. For those who need a firmer bed, you might not want such a cushiony sleep - I loved it. When we returned to the room at night, we found our bed turned down with pleasant music from the radio. Perhaps a bit creepy to have someone turn the bed down ....... but it was sweet.
reviews.title: BEST LOCATION !!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: Awesome big bathroom with both a bathtub and a separate stand-in shower. My favorite extra bonus was that on our first night, in the lobby, the hotel was offering a free cocktail albeit small but nevertheless ........
reviews.title: Comfy hotel convenient to Rittenhouse square.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Location was perfect - easy access to everything. We will absolutely stay there again. One small annoying thing is that the hotel staff greeted us repeatedly with "Bonjour" - not sure why - and twice my automatic response prompted me to say "Bonjour" back. I found it a bit pretentious but our stay was comfortable and relaxing, and I felt as if we were treated like royalty - so I can ignore the silly greeting.
reviews.title: Follow up stay was much better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Oh and it was our first trip to Philly - and I loved it. Awesome food at inexpensive prices. We're definitely going back.
reviews.title: Nice, good location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I stayed here while doing a road trip around the states last year. Although it certainly wasn't in our road trip budget, our visit to philidelphia fell on my birthday and the stay here was a gift for us to enjoy some luxury after some cheaper hotels!
reviews.title: Beds like a cloud!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As it was my birthday, we were upgraded to a suite. The room was gorgeous and the bed was like nothing I've ever slept in. Deliciously soft and I didn't want to ever get up!
reviews.title: Highly Recommended in French Quarter

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only slight downside was the long wait for your car to be returned from the valet parking - although in fairness this is well advertised, and the lack of free wifi. My partner also got prepositioned in the lift but that's another tale!
reviews.title: Fine hotel- but not deserving of the gushing praise on this site

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: All in all a very luxurious stay in a lovely city.
reviews.title: Royal Treatment

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: We are a NYC couple who has high sandards and travelled to 5-star hotels. The Sofitel is by far one of the best places with good value and were quite impressed all around. Upon arrival, we were treated as special guests with an upgrade to a suite, trays of deserts and fresh fruit as we celebrated our anniversary. We had early check-n and wee allowed to check out later. The suite had a large comfy king bed and great bathe with L'Occitane products to luxuriate in. The hotel also has a state of the art gym with fresh apples. We hope to return and/or stay at other Sofitel properties.
reviews.title: Better Value Elsewhere
Great view
reviews.text: Had a very comfortable stay and I appreciate that they offer free wifi (a rare occurrence for the more upscale hotels) and a 24 hour gym. No pool. Fitness machines are all new with individual TVs and there's a weight section as well. Food wise, the meals were decent at the meetings which I assume we're catered from the hotel kitchen. Standard fare of hash browns, bacon, eggs, fruit, etc... for breakfast and nicer items such as steak and fish with soups and salads for lunch.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Did not have a rental car so I can't comment on the parking or valet service.
reviews.title: Ruined anniversary got worse when they took our money and never even replied to emails

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived at the Sofitel we were made to feel welcome. The room was lovely, comfortable and spotless. The furniture was modern and the room offered every facility from shower robe to coffee, nail files to sewing kit. They had thought about everything.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bathroom had a tub and separate shower. The staff couldn't have been nicer and a special thank you must go to Hector on the front desk who was exceptionally helpful and Jamal who knew what we wanted before we knew ourselves.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel Gerat Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone who was visiting Philly. It is about a 20 minute walk from both the museum district and Independence Park. Shops and restaurants surround it.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel - Great Service

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had left our daughter for school this week and wanted to stay in the Rittenhouse section of Center City. The night before going I found a last minute deal on a king room that I assume is a standard room. Cost was under $180 for the night and looked to be a good deal. Upon check in I asked if there were any complementary ungraded and the desk staff put us on the top floor, The room was very nice with cosmetic issues that most likely only myself would find and it made me realize the cost value in the price per night we paid. I'm sure the hotel is under some room renovations and with that, have discounted some rooms 20 to 25%. Besides that the room was nice, large TV, huge very nice bathroom, Kurig coffee system, Bose Radio, very nice bed, nice view from the top floor and all in all I would go back at the price I paid and most likely pay more for an upgrade . The staff at the hotel are first class along with the lounge and restaurants. The area is very nice and with shops and restaurants all over it makes the hotel smack in the center of a great location. Parking is about $40 a night so keep that in mind, but there are other places to park in the area in order to save a few $$.
reviews.title: Wait for the Renovation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2012, traveled with family
reviews.text: We stayed here the first week of August - really enjoyed the hotel. Amazingly comfortable bed - we didn't want to get out of it. Hotel is within walkable distance of most of Philly's historic sights. Front desk very helpful as was the concierge who was able to get us tickets to the Barnes Foundation even though it was sold out. He was also knowledgeable about restaurants, bus tours etc. We were glad we asked his advice. We ate in the hotel restaurant, which is an extension of the lounge. Meal was okay but not spectacular, but the service was attentive.
reviews.title: Great Center City Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2012, traveled on business
reviews.text: Let me say upfront that I have never stayed in this hotel, so I can't say anything about their rooms and service staff. Maybe they are great, I will never know.
reviews.title: Very good location and excellent service
Pretty Lobby and Rooms; Friendly Staff
reviews.text: Last year I had booked a junior suite for our anniversary, but then something happened at my husband's office 2 days before our planned trip, and he would not be able to be absent from his office during that period. I was then asking the hotel if we could please move that booking to a few days later, as we were not able to come on that planned date. No reply at all! Nothing!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I had written emails to the customer service and had asked for advice, as this situation came very unexpected, and I didn't know what to do and what my options were. They never replied, not one sentence I got from them, just nothing, no reaction at all. But of course they kept the money!
reviews.title: Bed Bugs and pinworm

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had the pleasure of staying at the Sofitel for our anniversary weekend. The hotel is lovely and in the heart of Philadelphia. A great location for shopping and dining. Everything is within walking distance of the hotel, which was terrific! The one small issue we had was our expectation of the hotel room assigned. It was a little smaller than expected and not as nice as I would have liked it to be; not bad, just not what I wanted. With just a call to the front desk, we were immediately moved to the larger "luxury room", very nice. We love the separate shower/ bath; great feature for the hotel. Everything there after was just perfect. The in room breakfast the following morning was delicious and all staff were extremely helpful with dinner reservations, valet parking, etc. I would recommend this hotel. Next time we are in Philadelphia overnight we will definitely stay at Sofitel!
reviews.title: Lovely Relaxing Anniversary Weekend at Sofitel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled solo
reviews.text: Using Jetsetter, I got a top floor junior suite (Rm 1421) with an open north view towards Liberty Place complex (and the Westin hotel, which is also nice!) for $120/night, which was an incredible deal. The hotel is located in a prime area within a couple blocks of Rittenhouse Square, and not terribly far from the historic sites and museums. The room was nicely furnished with small, but acceptable, signs of wear. The layout and size were great, with a bathroom that could be accessed from the room entrance (like most hotels) or via the dressing area with two closets on the far side (UNlike most hotels!). The bathroom had a separate stall shower and tub, expanses of marble and L'Occitaine products everywhere--many of which came home with me. The bed was feathers above, below and under your head. There was only the feather duvet on the bed, no blanket or sheets, which made regulating temperature an all or nothing proposition in the warm weather. But it was luxurious nonetheless. I ordered one cheese and fruit plate from room service, which was delicious, well-presented and delivered exactly at the promised time. I did not use the valet parking or need the concierge's assistance, but the Front Desk staff I dealt with briefly were all very friendly, though the "bonjours" delivered with a pronounced Philadelphia accent were amusingly over the top. Overall, I was very favorably impressed with this hotel and could recommend it to anyone, especially if they can score one of the junior suites.
reviews.title: Superior Sofitel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Sofitel in Feb. '09 for a quick weekend to get away. It was great; it turned out to be right downtown in a very convenient location (close to Rittenhouse Square, even walkable from the Liberty Bell, etc. although I wouldn't do that walk on a colder day). The room was very comfortable and the bathroom was great (good shower, etc.) The bar downstairs was actually a pretty popular place to hang out for people who weren't even staying at the hotel, making it more fun and less quiet than some hotel bars. The gym was good but a little small - people seemed to really covet the two elliptical machines, so maybe they want to look into getting more of those. Also, the ethernet cord was broken in our room, but I'm sure they would have fixed it if we asked. The business "center" was a little kiosk off of the bar, but I just needed to print something, so it was perfect. I just wouldn't plan to do real work there. Overall, we were very pleased and would definitely stay again.
reviews.title: Super Convenient, Great Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the Sofitel Philadelphia for a weekend getaway. We thought the hotel was good, but not great.
reviews.title: Good, but not great

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pros: Great location close to Rittenhouse Square; fairly new and trendy hotel; great concierge service; good price for center city Philadelphia hotel; nice flatscreen tvs
reviews.title: Good value, great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Cons: Shower water pressure low; toilet had problems flushing; bed too soft (mattress looked really old); bad ventilation in room (felt stuffy); a general feeling that the room was not cleaned very well (didn't feel fresh).
reviews.title: Great beds, rooms, service and value.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We probably would return to Sofitel when we're back in Philadelphia unless there's a better option next time.
reviews.title: Loved this hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: This hotel was great. It was one block from fabulous shopping and great eateries. It was also walking distance (20 minutes) to the convention center and to the historic parks (30 minutes). The hotel lobby was very modern and the bell service and car valet staff were excellent upon our arrival and check-out. the room had the best bed we've ever had at a US hotel and the crib was great for our toddler, not a flimsy fold away that buckle under the tossing and turning. The bathroom seemed to be recently renovated with solid surface counters, all glass shower enclosure and separate tub. Room service was yummy and reasonably priced as big city hotels go. The hotel isn't bargain priced, but you get what you pay for and this was well worth our money. This will be the only place we stay when visiting Philly!
reviews.title: Loved this hotel! Great Location, Clean Modern and Best Beds Ever!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled with family
reviews.text: Having left what we felt was the over-priced; over-rated Residence Inn in NYC it was great arrving at this very smart hotel! I read with interest the review of the previous contributor and the fact that at the time of writing already 2 people had marked the review as being unhelpful! The absolute truth is that the review is pretty much spot on! We were very happy with our room and the hotel in general and would certainly go back there but it was not perfect. There were 3 of us (my wife and I and our 22 year old daughter) and whilst the room was good/very well sized/bathroom massive etc we found it odd that such a size room should have 2 standard (4' 6") beds which was great for our 22 year old but a little too cosy for us oldies; which was odd given the amount of space in the room. We were happy enough really but mentioned this in passing to the receptionist who really failed to see our point and in fact looked at us as if we were slight mad! She said all the 2 bed rooms have that size bed. We then asked for details of the location of the Sofitel in NYC; again the request was met by a less than enthusiastic response along the lines of we don't really have much to do with them but I suppose we could find out the address if it's really important....we said please don't trouble yourself! Anyway unlike the previous reviewer we did use the restaurant both for dinner and breakfast and although not that cheap we were very happy on each occasion. In the evenings a waiter called Kyle could not have been more friendly and attentive and the same applied to Paul, our waiter in the mornings. The manager also introduced himself, was quite charming, chatted for a while and was genuinely interested in our feedback. So all in all very happy until the last night (a Friday) when the club mentioned in the previous review kicked in with thumping music which also kept us awake until almost dawn. I believe it's called The Raven and is at the back of the hotel. When I reported this to reception I got a very off-hand comment that it's outside their control. They said that they get numerous complaints and when the hotel is less full they try to allocate guests to quieter rooms at weekends. So in summary, next time we would probably stay at the Sofitel but not unless they could guarantee us a quiet room and ideally a larger bed!
reviews.title: Really nice hotel!!! Shame about the thumping music from next door!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: My first time staying at a Sofitel. Having heard so much, I went with some expectations and was quite disappointed. I checked into the hotel and was given a smoking room. My reservation was made through a package with American Express and I had requested a non-smoking room. Once I got to the room, I immediately called down to the front desk and the phone rang over 10 times before I decided to just hang up and head back down to the lobby as no one was picking up the phone. My room was changed as requested, which was nice. However, the wake up call I was offered never came through the next morning. Luckily, I had set my cell phone alarm as a back up. There was no offer of luggage assistance or any other assistance as is usually the custom upon checking in at a quality hotel. The rest of my stay was rather uneventful until Friday night which was very unfortunate. Being that I was there for a conference, I was trying to get some sleep but could not get any rest until well into dawn due to the constant thumping of the music at a nearby club. When I called down to the front desk, the attendant merely said, "The clubs close at 2am." There was no offer to possibly change rooms or anything. Even if the employee had been sympathetic, it would have been nice. Of course there is nothing the hotel could do about the situation, but this might have been something that could have been disclosed to the customer. The following morning at checkout, I was surprised to not have the front desk attendant ask about my stay. She simply handed me my receipt and I was on my way. I do not know if this is a problem with the staffing at this particular Sofitel location, but I am not inclined to try another location to find out. Never have I encountered such lack of effort in providing service at a hotel.
reviews.title: Refined luxury hospitality--not quite

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service aside, the room was nice though the walls were a bit thin. There really isn't a business center. Their business center is a desk with 3 computers along the wall in the bar/lounge area and the printer is out of service. Also, due to the fact that it is in the bar/lounge area, it is dimly lit and not very conducive to work. The work out room is decent with clean towels and water. I did not try the restaurant, but the bar/lounge was fair. Once again, the service was just ok. The location of the hotel is great...if you don't mind the loud music from the nearby clubs on the weekends.
reviews.title: Really quite nice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled on business
reviews.text: Booked this hotel for an overnight stay based on other TA reviews. With a bright and spacious hotel lobby and lively bar, the front desk was friendly and quick. The room was a king bed suite with modern furniture. There was a dressing area, a beautiful clean spacious bathroom, living room complete with a LCD tv with french doors that closed off the bedroom which also had a LCD tv.The king bed/mattress was a bit odd, as if there was a mound in the center of the bed with it sloping off to the edges of the mattress which were hard. There was a only comforter, no flat sheet. It got quite warm using a comforter in spring. We ate breakfast in the hotel in the morning. Buffet is a bit pricey @ $19 a pop which after doing the math was a better deal than ordering items a la carte. Server was attentive and friendly. Valet parking was helpful and friendly but pricey at $30 which was included in our package. Even the housekeeper who was cleaning the room across from ours, was friendly. I would stay here again most definitely.
reviews.title: excellent stay and service in rittenhouse square area

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An excellent two night stay at this hotel. Valet parking, Reception check in and baggage delivery were all quietly efficient. We opted for a Junior Suite over a Deluxe room at only $50 a night extra and got a spacious, well equipped room as a result.
reviews.title: Top class hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast service was pleasant and efficient. Overall, a well run hotel just two minutes off lively Rittenhouse Square which offers a good choice of restaurants. Some 15-20 minutes walk to the historic quarter of Philladelphia, the Sofitel would make a good choice for your stay in the city.
reviews.title: Great Stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled with family
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for weekend getaway. The bed was very relaxing and the bathroom was very roomy (especially if two people are getting ready). I loved the glass shower and room decor. Everything we did was in walking distance or we caught a cab so we didn't have to deal with parking. Overall, we enjoyed our stay.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel, but...

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have a very nice stay in the Sofitel, everything was awesome but, no wi-fi on the rooms, and expensive parking.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2012
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed here in December 2011. The hotel looked very nice and clean... but then we had a bed bug event. We woke up at 4 AM to find a bed bug crawling across the white down comforter and there were little specks of blood on the bed sheets. We checked the sheets and found more in the pillowcase. We complained and they immediately changed our room but we were still very nervous and had to check all the sheets and blankets. They comped our breakfast the next morning as well. They told us that they couldn't find any sign of bed bugs the next day. They were very apologetic and polite about the event but I still felt like we had been accused of lying. I'm sure they probably just rented out the room again to some other unsuspecting sucker. I used the hotel lobby bathroom the next morning and when I turned on the faucet, what I thought was a fingernail lying in the sink started squirming. It was a pinworm. Someone had obviously changed their child's baby diaper in the sink and left behind remnants. I would've loved this hotel had it not been for the bed bugs and the pinworm.
reviews.title: Lovely hotel. Softiels are good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Lovely location. Plenty of bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: Wonderful weekend in the heart of the City

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This past weekend my wife and I stayed at the Sofitel for a romantic getaway from the kids. I found a good rate through Expedia for $180.00 including all taxes. If you like a central location, safety, upscale amenities, modern decor, and professional service this is the place for you. From the moment you arrive at the front of the hotel the valets and bellmen are at your service. Before I knew it they were wisking my car away and escorting me into the lobby. A funny thing about this hotel is that they seemed more concerned about providing good service than receiving a tip. In fact, one female employee working with the valets was helping me out with my vehicle on a side-street next to the hotel. When I went to tip her for her services she refused. I've travelled all over the country and Europe and that doesn't generally happen.
reviews.title: Sofitel in Philly was great!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2009, traveled solo
reviews.text: Inside the hotel, check-in was a breeze. The front desk personnel were professional and very accomodating. The concierge was available late into the evening and was very helpful providing information on restaurants and tours of the city.
reviews.title: Excellent choice for center city

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room itself had a very nice modern decor. All the amenities necessary for an enjoyable stay were present: complimentary water, bathrobes, nicely stocked minibar, iron/ironing board, hairdryer, and nice toiletries. What really stood out was the size of the room, bathroom included, and the comfortable bed.
reviews.title: we will be back

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: After we got settled in the room we went down to the bar/lounge since our dinner reservations weren't for another few hours. The lounge is very comfortable and is a nice way to start off the evening. The bartenders make strong drinks and the wait staff check in on you regularly without being obtrusive. We tried an appetizer that held us over until dinner. It was very tasty and reasonably priced.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Everything at this hotel was great
likes.disliked: — The parking situation isn't too good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The following morning we had breakfast at the hotel which was good. All things considered, it wasn't too expensive compared to other hotels($28.00 for two). In general, the food has a French/American twist. One nice thing is that your juice and coffee are included in the cost of your meal.
reviews.title: Fantastic stay

description: The Sofitel Philadelphia hotel blends French elegance with American style, providing a refined environment for upscale business and leisure travel. Experience this sophisticated downtown Philadelphia hotel, which serves as the cornerstone of the new French Quarter, steps from Rittenhouse Square. Offering the height of contemporary comfort and convenience, this downtown Philadelphia Pennsylvania hotel provides the ideal setting, just minutes from the convention center and historical attractions.
